title: 6:16 in LA (Live at Kia Forum)
lyrics: Uh
Solo
Solo
It's survival
(Ab-Solo) Survival, ah
I guess somebody lyin'
Smells like somebody lyin'
I don't see no motherfuckin' fire
What's up, Dot?
Off-white Sunseeker at the marina (Uh-huh)
Fuck a Phantom, I like to buy yachts when I get the fever (Uh-huh)
Wine cooler spill on my white t-shirt, the sightseer (Hmm)
Trifecta, money, morals, and culture, that's my leisure
My visa, passport tatted, I should hub in Ibiza
Lucalis dwellings in Brooklyn just to book me some pizza
Who could reach us? Only God could teleport this type of freedom
God, ah, my confession is yours, but
Who am I if I don't go to war? (Who are you?)
There's opportunity when livin' with loss (Yeah)
I discover myself when I fall short
Raise my hands to a fallen sky, I fantasize
Me jumpin' planets immortalized, I correspond
Three angels watchin' me all the time
Put my children to sleep with a prayer, then close my eyes
Definition of peace
Tell me who gon' stop me? I come from love (Who?)
Estelle cover my heart, then open me up
Remember when picked up a pen, lyrics that I can trust
Timid soul, stare in the mirror, askin' where I was from
Often, I know this type of power is gon' cost (Yeah)
But I live in circadian rhythms of a shooting star (Yeah)
Mannerisms of Raphael, I can heal and give you art
But the industry's cooked as I pick the carcass apart
